channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Enhancing person re-identification via Uncertainty Feature Fusion Method and Auto-weighted Measure Combination
item.description: On the Occluded-DukeMTMC dataset, our method increases Rank@1 by 22. 0% and mAP by 18. 4%.

item.title: Simulation-Aided Policy Tuning for Black-Box Robot Learning
item.description: At the core of the algorithm, a probabilistic model learns the dependence of the policy parameters and the robot learning objective not only by performing experiments on the robot, but also by leveraging data from a simulator.

item.title: Learning to Cooperate with Humans using Generative Agents
item.description: By sampling from the latent space, we can use the generative model to produce different partners to train Cooperator agents.

item.title: GASP: Efficient Black-Box Generation of Adversarial Suffixes for Jailbreaking LLMs
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown impressive proficiency across a range of natural language processing tasks yet remain vulnerable to adversarial prompts, known as jailbreak attacks, carefully designed to elicit harmful responses from LLMs.

item.title: Automatic brain tumor segmentation in 2D intra-operative ultrasound images using MRI tumor annotations
item.description: This shows that MRI tumor annotations can be used as a substitute for US tumor annotations to train a deep learning model for automatic brain tumor segmentation in intra-operative ultrasound images.

item.title: Self-supervised learning for radio-astronomy source classification: a benchmark
item.description: This study explores the application of SSL to radio astronomy, comparing the performance of SSL-trained models with that of traditional models pretrained on natural images, evaluating the importance of data curation for SSL, and assessing the potential benefits of self-supervision to different domain-specific radio astronomy datasets.

item.title: HARP: A Large-Scale Higher-Order Ambisonic Room Impulse Response Dataset
item.description: This contribution introduces a dataset of 7th-order Ambisonic Room Impulse Responses (HOA-RIRs), created using the Image Source Method.

item.title: Hugging Rain Man: A Novel Facial Action Units Dataset for Analyzing Atypical Facial Expressions in Children with Autism Spectrum Disorder
item.description: Children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) often exhibit atypical facial expressions.

item.title: Detecting Human Artifacts from Text-to-Image Models
item.description: In this study, we address this challenge by curating Human Artifact Dataset (HAD), the first large-scale dataset specifically designed to identify and localize human artifacts.

item.title: Evaluating the Robustness of Analogical Reasoning in Large Language Models
item.description: For each domain we test humans and GPT models on robustness to variants of the original analogy problems that test the same abstract reasoning abilities but are likely dissimilar from tasks in the pre-training data.

item.title: Sli2Vol+: Segmenting 3D Medical Images Based on an Object Estimation Guided Correspondence Flow Network
item.description: To address these challenges, in this work, we propose a new SSF, called \proposed, {for segmenting any anatomical structures in 3D medical images using only a single annotated slice per training and testing volume.}

item.title: Efficient Aspect-Based Summarization of Climate Change Reports with Small Language Models
item.description: The use of Natural Language Processing (NLP) for helping decision-makers with Climate Change action has recently been highlighted as a use case aligning with a broader drive towards NLP technologies for social good.

item.title: Exploring applications of topological data analysis in stock index movement prediction
item.description: Topological Data Analysis (TDA) has recently gained significant attention in the field of financial prediction.

item.title: A Dataset for Evaluating Online Anomaly Detection Approaches for Discrete Multivariate Time Series
item.description: To cater for both unsupervised and semi-supervised anomaly detection settings, as well as time series generation and forecasting, we make different versions of the dataset available, where training and test subsets are offered in contaminated and clean versions, depending on the task.

item.title: Teaching MLPs to Master Heterogeneous Graph-Structured Knowledge for Efficient and Accurate Inference
item.description: Heterogeneous Graph Neural Networks (HGNNs) have achieved promising results in various heterogeneous graph learning tasks, owing to their superiority in capturing the intricate relationships and diverse relational semantics inherent in heterogeneous graph structures.

item.title: Differentiable SVD based on Moore-Penrose Pseudoinverse for Inverse Imaging Problems
item.description: In this paper, we propose a differentiable SVD based on the Moore-Penrose pseudoinverse to address this issue.

item.title: WARLearn: Weather-Adaptive Representation Learning
item.description: Leveraging the in-variance principal used in Barlow Twins, we demonstrate the capability to port the existing models initially trained on clear weather data to effectively handle adverse weather conditions.

item.title: RV4Chatbot: Are Chatbots Allowed to Dream of Electric Sheep?
item.description: We formalise expected behaviours as interaction protocols between the user and the chatbot.

item.title: NewsInterview: a Dataset and a Playground to Evaluate LLMs' Ground Gap via Informational Interviews
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated impressive capabilities in generating coherent text but often struggle with grounding language and strategic dialogue.

item.title: REFOL: Resource-Efficient Federated Online Learning for Traffic Flow Forecasting
item.description: Therefore, we propose a novel method named Resource-Efficient Federated Online Learning (REFOL) for TFF, which guarantees prediction performance in a communication-lightweight and computation-efficient way.

item.title: Robust Detection of Watermarks for Large Language Models Under Human Edits
item.description: We prove that the Tr-GoF test achieves optimality in robust detection of the Gumbel-max watermark in a certain asymptotic regime of substantial text modifications and vanishing watermark signals.

item.title: Out-Of-Distribution Detection with Diversification (Provably)
item.description: Out-of-distribution (OOD) detection is crucial for ensuring reliable deployment of machine learning models.

item.title: Persistent Homology for Structural Characterization in Disordered Systems
item.description: We propose a unified framework based on persistent homology (PH) to characterize both local and global structures in disordered systems.

item.title: DRPruning: Efficient Large Language Model Pruning through Distributionally Robust Optimization
item.description: To address this, we propose DRPruning, which incorporates distributionally robust optimization to restore balanced performance across domains, along with further improvements to enhance robustness.

item.title: RestorerID: Towards Tuning-Free Face Restoration with ID Preservation
item.description: RestorerID is a diffusion model-based method that restores low-quality images with varying levels of degradation by using a single reference image.

item.title: Uncertainty-Aware Regression for Socio-Economic Estimation via Multi-View Remote Sensing
item.description: However, much of this research has primarily focused on daytime satellite imagery due to the limitation that most pre-trained models are trained on 3-band RGB images.

item.title: UnifiedCrawl: Aggregated Common Crawl for Affordable Adaptation of LLMs on Low-Resource Languages
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) under-perform on low-resource languages due to limited training data.

item.title: Stereo Anything: Unifying Stereo Matching with Large-Scale Mixed Data
item.description: To further enrich the model's ability to generalize across different conditions, we introduce a novel synthetic dataset that complements existing data by adding variability in baselines, camera angles, and scene types.

item.title: Zero-Shot Low-Light Image Enhancement via Joint Frequency Domain Priors Guided Diffusion
item.description: To address this problem, we will propose a new zero-shot low-light enhancement method to compensate for the lack of light and structural information in the diffusion sampling process by effectively combining the wavelet and Fourier frequency domains to construct rich a priori information.

item.title: Revisiting the Integration of Convolution and Attention for Vision Backbone
item.description: Specifically, in each layer, we use two different ways to represent an image: a fine-grained regular grid and a coarse-grained set of semantic slots.

item.title: FunctionChat-Bench: Comprehensive Evaluation of Language Models' Generative Capabilities in Korean Tool-use Dialogs
item.description: This study investigates language models' generative capabilities in tool-use dialogs.

item.title: POS-tagging to highlight the skeletal structure of sentences
item.description: This study presents the development of a part-of-speech (POS) tagging model to extract the skeletal structure of sentences using transfer learning with the BERT architecture for token classification.

item.title: Indiscriminate Disruption of Conditional Inference on Multivariate Gaussians
item.description: The multivariate Gaussian distribution underpins myriad operations-research, decision-analytic, and machine-learning models (e. g., Bayesian optimization, Gaussian influence diagrams, and variational autoencoders).

item.title: CLIPer: Hierarchically Improving Spatial Representation of CLIP for Open-Vocabulary Semantic Segmentation
item.description: The proposed CLIPer includes an early-layer fusion module and a fine-grained compensation module.

item.title: Creating a Formally Verified Neural Network for Autonomous Navigation: An Experience Report
item.description: The increased reliance of self-driving vehicles on neural networks opens up the challenge of their verification.

item.title: MMGenBench: Evaluating the Limits of LMMs from the Text-to-Image Generation Perspective
item.description: Furthermore, we introduce MMGenBench-Test, a comprehensive benchmark developed to evaluate LMMs across 13 distinct image patterns, and MMGenBench-Domain, targeting the performance evaluation of LMMs within the generative image domain.

item.title: SemiKong: Curating, Training, and Evaluating A Semiconductor Industry-Specific Large Language Model
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated the potential to address some issues within the semiconductor industry.

item.title: Layer Pruning with Consensus: A Triple-Win Solution
item.description: Layer pruning offers a promising alternative to standard structured pruning, effectively reducing computational costs, latency, and memory footprint.

item.title: Uncertainty Quantification in Working Memory via Moment Neural Networks
item.description: This study applies moment neural networks (MNNs) to explore the neural mechanism of uncertainty quantification in working memory (WM).

item.title: Regional Attention for Shadow Removal
item.description: Shadow, as a natural consequence of light interacting with objects, plays a crucial role in shaping the aesthetics of an image, which however also impairs the content visibility and overall visual quality.

item.title: OpenScholar: Synthesizing Scientific Literature with Retrieval-augmented LMs
item.description: Scientific progress depends on researchers' ability to synthesize the growing body of literature.

item.title: Dealing with Synthetic Data Contamination in Online Continual Learning
item.description: Also, we propose Entropy Selection with Real-synthetic similarity Maximization (ESRM), a method to alleviate the performance deterioration caused by synthetic images when training online CL models.

item.title: Insight-V: Exploring Long-Chain Visual Reasoning with Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: In this paper, we present Insight-V, an early effort to 1) scalably produce long and robust reasoning data for complex multi-modal tasks, and 2) an effective training pipeline to enhance the reasoning capabilities of multi-modal large language models (MLLMs).

item.title: BERT-Based Approach for Automating Course Articulation Matrix Construction with Explainable AI
item.description: This work demonstrates the potential of utilizing transfer learning with BERT-based models for the automated generation of CAMs, offering high performance and interpretability in educational outcome assessment.

item.title: Multimodal Autoregressive Pre-training of Large Vision Encoders
item.description: We introduce a novel method for pre-training of large-scale vision encoders.

item.title: Transforming Static Images Using Generative Models for Video Salient Object Detection
item.description: This ability allows the model to generate plausible optical flows, preserving semantic integrity while reflecting the independent motion of scene elements.

item.title: Neuromorphic Attitude Estimation and Control
item.description: On the real drone the perception-to-control SNN tracks attitude commands with an average error of $3$ degrees, compared to $2. 5$ degrees for the regular flight stack.

item.title: Global and Local Attention-Based Transformer for Hyperspectral Image Change Detection
item.description: The global attention component employs global attention on downsampled feature maps to capture low-frequency information, while the local attention component focuses on high-frequency details using non-overlapping window-based local attention.

item.title: FedRAV: Hierarchically Federated Region-Learning for Traffic Object Classification of Autonomous Vehicles
item.description: However, considering the complicated traffic environments and driving scenarios, deploying federated learning for autonomous vehicles is inevitably challenged by non-independent and identically distributed (Non-IID) data of vehicles, which may lead to failed convergence and low training accuracy.

item.title: Why do language models perform worse for morphologically complex languages?
item.description: We then propose and test three possible causes for this performance gap: morphological alignment of tokenizers, tokenization quality, and disparities in dataset sizes and measurement.
